1.text: Balances of deceit, an abomination of Jehovah: and a whole stone his delight.

2.text: Pride coming, and dishonor will come: and wisdom with the humble.

3.text: The integrity of the upright shall guide them: and the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.

4.text: Wealth will not profit in the day of wrath, and justice will deliver from death.

5.text: The justice of the blameless shall make straight his way, and in his injustice the unjust shall fall.

6.text: The justice of the upright shall deliver them, and transgressors shall be taken in their mischief.

7.text: In the death of an unjust man expectation shall perish: and the hope of the vain shall perish.

8.text: The just one was delivered from straits, and the unjust will come in his stead.

9.text: With the mouth the profane will destroy his neighbor: and by knowledge, shall the just one be delivered.

10.text: In the good of the just the city will exult: and in the perishing of the unjust it rejoiced.

11.text: By the blessing of the upright the city shall be exalted: and by the mouth of the unjust it shall be overthrown.

12.text: He wanting heart despised for his neighbor: and a man of understanding will be silent.

13.text: He going about tale-bearing reveals a secret: and he being faithful of spirit hides the word.

14.text: In no guidance the people will fall: and salvation in a multitude of counseling.

15.text: The evil one shall become evil, for he became surety for a stranger: and he hating those striking hands being secure.

16.text: A woman of grace will obtain honor, and the powerful will obtain riches.

17.text: The man of mercy benefited his soul: and the cruel troubled his flesh.

18.text: The unjust one did a work of falsehood: and the seed of justice the reward of truth.

19.text: So justice to life, and he pursuing evil, to his death.

20.text: The perverse of heart are an abomination of Jehovah, and the blameless of way his delight.

21.text: Hand to hand, the evil one shall not be unpunished: and the seed of the just were delivered.

22.text: A ring of gold in the nose of a swine, a fair woman and she departed from discernment.

23.text: The desire of the just is only good: the expectation of the unjust, wrath.

24.text: There is scattering and yet adding; and the withholding more than right, only to want.

25.text: The soul of blessing shall be made fat: also he watering, shall himself drink to the full.

26.text: He withholding grain, the people shall curse him: and blessing upon the head of him selling.

27.text: He seeking good shall strive after acceptance: and he seeking evil, it shall come to him.

28.text: He trusting in his riches himself shall fall: and the just shall flourish as the foliage.

29.text: He troubling his house shall inherit wind: and the foolish is servant to the wise of heart.

30.text: The fruit of the just a tree of life; and he taking souls is wise.

31.text: Behold, the just shall be requited in the earth: much more the unjust one and the sinning.
